meanings.definition: A group of phosphoproteins found in the egg yolk of most oviparous animals.
meanings.sent1: The vitellogenins provide essential nutrients for the developing embryos.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study vitellogenins to understand the growth of eggs in animals.
meanings.sent3: The curious chicken wondered if the vitellogenins made the egg yolk taste better.
meanings.sent4: Her love for her children was as rich and nurturing as vitellogenins in egg yolks.
meanings.sent5: The golden hue of the yolk was a testament to the presence of vitellogenins.

meanings.definition: Proteins that are synthesized in the liver and transported to the ovary for incorporation into the yolk of developing eggs.
meanings.sent1: The vitellogenins play a crucial role in the formation of egg yolk.
meanings.sent2: Farmers ensure the hens have enough vitellogenins for healthy egg production.
meanings.sent3: The liver sent a special delivery of vitellogenins to the ovary for the eggs.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to her work was like the seamless journey of vitellogenins from liver to ovary.
meanings.sent5: The ovary eagerly awaited the arrival of vitellogenins to complete the egg yolk.
